result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin Valadez

defendant.name: Valadez, Martin
defendant.address: 1113 Park Row St, Lake Geneva, WI 53147

records.addlTxt: Defendant not in court. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Maynard requesting to withdraw as counsel. Must file motion. Minutes filed.

2:28PM - (64-06) Defendant Martin Valadez not in court.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeramiah Maynard in court for Martin Valadez.
Interpreter Bruce Goodman in court, sworn by clerk.
Attorney Maynard has had issues contacting defendant. Does not have a valid phone number. Attorney Maynard is requesting two (2) weeks to contact defendant.
ADA Herrmann objects for reasons stated on the record and is requesting Warrant to issue and Bond Forfeited.

Court will issue a Warrant for Martin Valadez arrest and Forfeits Bond.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Martin Valadez in court. Attorney Tony Kim appeared. Waiver of Time Limits for Preliminary hearing. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Martin Valadez appeared by video, in custody. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Andrew Herrmann. Called @ 2:04 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on 22CF209 and adjourned initial appearances on other files - 22CF197, 22CF198, and 21CM284. Record by Atty. Kim that he was under the impression that the defendant would be hiring private counsel. Response by the DE. Atty. Kim asks that all matter be put on Monday at 1:15 so he can go over new complaint with the defendant and determine how to move forward. Current date for preliminary hearing remains on at this time. Court sets as requested. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
